intro: Eulychnia vallenarensis, commonly known as the Valle de los Caídos cactus, is a species of cactus native to Chile. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, with thick, fleshy stems that store water. It typically grows in rocky soils and is found in the central and southern regions of Chile. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
